contextId.occurrenceNote: This is most likely the beginning of a song or poem that Paul is quoting. If your language has a way of indicating that this is poetry, you could use it here. If not, you could translate this as regular prose rather than poetry. (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/writing-poetry]])
contextId.glQuote: If we have died with him, we will also live with him

contextId.occurrenceNote: This is most likely the end of a song or poem that Paul is quoting. If your language has a way of indicating that this is poetry you could use it here. If not, you could translate this as regular prose rather than poetry. (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/writing-poetry]])
contextId.quote: εἰ ἀπιστοῦμεν ... ἀρνήσασθαι ... ἑαυτὸν οὐ δύναται
contextId.glQuote: if we are unfaithful ... he cannot deny himself
